Title: Data Governance Maturity Assessment at PT. XYZ. Case Study: Data Management Division
Source title: Proceedings of 2018 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2018
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Permana, R.I., Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Suroso, J.S., Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study is to assess the maturity level of data governance in order to provide appropriate recommendations to address the problems of data governance in the Data Management Division. The research method used begins with a literature study and survey, which aims to identify the company's vision, mission, objectives and identify the IT resources used by the company today. It then identifies the company's business objectives, objectives and Division strategies, and ongoing processes in the division. The results obtained a gap between the current maturity level with the maturity level that has not reached the company's expectations. The conclusion obtained that the data governance at PT. XYZ can still be improved. The improvement is taken from DAMA DMBOK as best practice on data governance, by identifying which area that the company did not have. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: DAMA DMBOK; data governance; data management; stanford maturity assessment
Index Keywords: Business objectives; DAMA DMBOK; Data governances; Literature studies; Management division; Maturity assessments; Maturity levels; research methods; Information management
